remarks: If the operation ` .+ ` has an absorbing element ` Z ` (a.k.a. zero element), then any sequence containing a ` Z ` evaluates to ` Z ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 27-May-2014.)
statement:
seqhomo.1 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. S /\ y e. S ) ) -> ( x .+ y ) e. S ) $.
seqhomo.2 $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. ( M ... N ) ) -> ( F ` x ) e. S ) $.
seqz.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. S ) -> ( Z .+ x ) = Z ) $.
seqz.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. S ) -> ( x .+ Z ) = Z ) $.
seqz.5 $e |- ( ph -> K e. ( M ... N ) ) $.
seqz.6 $e |- ( ph -> N e. V ) $.
seqz.7 $e |- ( ph -> ( F ` K ) = Z ) $.
seqz $p |- ( ph -> ( seq M ( .+ , F ) ` N ) = Z ) $.
$d .+ x y $.
$d F x y $.
$d K x y $.
$d M x y $.
$d N x y $.
$d S x y $.
$d Z x y $.
$d ph x y $.
